result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett W Garvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on July 25, 2014.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must have no contact with Lorena Benjamin unless she and Probation Agent agree.

Must engage in some sort of support meetings.
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
11/03/2014 AMENDED: MUST COMPLY WITH MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

timeConds.notes: 11/03/2014 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS 90 DAYS CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME WITH WORK SEARCH AND WORK RELEASE.  COURT GRANTS 17 DAYS JAIL CREDIT IF PROBATION IS REVOKED.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Must maintain absolute sobriety.  May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed.

6/5/15 Sentencing hearing on revocation.

Defendant Garrett W Garvin in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Garrett W Garvin in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
7/22/14 Letter from Attorney Weber to Judge Boyle regarding preliminary hearing

Defendant Garrett W Garvin in court with attorney Julie Ann Weber.  Defendant Garrett W Garvin in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF79, 14CF201 and 14CF212 called.  Attorney Weber recites agreement.  State relates.  Defense and State waive PSI.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

14CF79 - Case Dismissed

14CF201 - Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  State will file Information.  Case Dismissed and Read-in

14CF212 - Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  State will file Information.

Count 1 - Guilty plea

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Court questions defendant.  Court waives PSI.  State relates.  Attorney Weber relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 3 years Probation - Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on July 25, 2014
Court costs
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must engage in some sort of support meetings
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Must work toward attaining GED
25 days jail - Credit for 25 days
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Must have no contact with Lorena B. unless she and Probation Agent agree
Julie Weber

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
$1500.00 CASH BOND TO COVER BOTH 14CF212 AND 14CF201.

Defendant Garrett W Garvin in court with attorney Julie A Weber who appears by phone.  Defendant Garrett W Garvin in custody.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF201: State moves to quash warrant. Court quashes warrant.
